none: Abre Du Ténéré - Quando Gli Uomini Adoravano La Luna
Quando Gli Uomini Adoravano La Luna
Abre Du Ténéré - Quando Gli Uomini Adoravano La Luna

Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on November 12, 2019 Description from Terminal Escape:
The "artist" in focus and/or question (today) is a somewhat less prolific collaboration between two considerably more prolific Italian noise/experimental monikers. The first cut sounds like it could be the introduction to an unknown prog band's set, and from there the duo flirts with primitive electronics (John Pfeiffer, Nic Raicevic) and space age soundtrack fodder. Everything is sparse, light...and freeing. The entire recording listens like a casual, but nonetheless-just-barely-missed, connection, and I'm left feeling unbothered and pleasant. What if all sound could have such an effect....? QUANDO GLI UOMINI ADORAVANO LA LUNA NOTE: Each copy comes with a photograph of the desert, and that is extremely fukkn cool. 
https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Mt6-FSpHKoY/Xcj-b4D_-KI/AAAAAAAAWEs/f7YtiOyB68Ie1QH6vO3ur8ruFqZLS3ADQCEwYBhgL/s1600/Arbe%2Bimg%2Bcopy.jpg
